parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I take up, (b) I welcome, entertain, (c) I answer, (d) I suppose, imagine.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Masculine Singular
Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) To show favor to, (b) To pardon, forgive, (c) To show kindness.
Or neuter pleion, or pleon comparative of polus; more in quantity, number, or quality; also the major portion.
Simon. Of Hebrew origin; Simon, the name of nine Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.
Rightly. Adverb from orthos; in a straight manner, i.e. correctly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
